name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course aims to help students learn the correct usage of English grammar (including parallelism, subordination and coordination) and master the paragraph-length writing. It will develop students’ writing skills from expressing an idea into a complete English sentence to organizing ideas into a structured paragraph. Students are expected to be able to use effective definition, description, illustration, argumentation and narration in their paragraph writing. Plenty of discussion will take place in class and active participation is highly required of students.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: Introducing the Paragraph 
Week 3: Narrating (I)
Week 4: Narrating (II)
Week 5: Describing (I)
Week 6: Describing (II)
Week 7: Tomb-sweeping Festival
Week 8: Analyzing Reasons (I)
Week 9: Mid-term Exam
Week 10: Analyzing Reasons (II) 
Week 11: Analyzing Processes (I)
Week 12: Analyzing Processes (II) 
Week 13: Comparing and Contrasting (I)
Week 14: Comparing and Contrasting (II)
Week 15: Classifying (I)
Week 16: Classifying (II)/Evaluating Effects (I)
Week 17: Evaluating Effects (II) 
Week 18: Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1. attendance & participation: 10%
2. exercises and quizzes: 20%
3. writing assignments and revisions: 30%
4. mid-term exam: 20%
5. final-exam: 20%
